blunder.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: A last-minute blunder cost them the match.
blunder.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to move in an unsteady way, as if you cannot see properly
blunder.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Someone was blundering about in the kitchen.
Phil came blundering down the stairs.
blunder.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
blunder.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
blunder.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to enter a place or become involved in a difficult situation by mistake
blunder.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Somehow we blundered into the war.
He would have agreed if you hadnâ€™t blundered in.
